alert.note: Alert for Camden; Chowan; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 11:17AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pasquotank, southeastern Camden, southeastern Perquimans, southeastern Currituck and southeastern Chowan Counties through NOON EDT... At 1117 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cape Colony, or 12 miles south of Hertford, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sanderling, Cape Colony, Point Harbor, Snug Harbor, Stevenson Point, Spot, Listers Corner, Saint Johns, Glen Cove, Harbinger, Jarvisburg, Frog Island, Powells Point, Somerset and Mamie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Chowan; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck
